ygData.subject: Donations
ygData.msgSnippet: Many of us have been watching the news today and wondering about certain things. Neccessities will be needed for the families and loved ones that are injured

Subject: Donations

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"

X-Mailer: CompuServe 2000 32-bit sub 107
From: KSLawdogg@...

 Many of us have been watching the news today and wondering about certain 
things. Neccessities will be needed for the families and loved ones that are 
injured or have just lost their homes. As such the Red Cross have set up a 
couple of information and donation lines. The first is a general information 
line set up just for this disaster it will give you times places and are even 
trying to find lost family and friends the number is 1-877-RED-CROSS Or you 
can use 1-800-HELP-NOW.
        The second number the red Cross has established is for those of you 
who may be willing to donate the neccessary blood to help the injured. 
1-800-GIVE-LIFE
        In either case donate time supplies of food or clothing, whatever you 
can spare. Donate to Red Cross, the Salvation Army or whatever local group 
you have. Thank you.
